raw_comment:
I noticed a few trends in the graph. It seems that the smallest percentage of people visit their parents in person (15-25%), while the largest percentage of young individuals (50-75%) reach out to their parents either daily or a few times a week. Additionally, the gender difference in communication habits, with women being 20% more likely to use text or video-chat compared to men.
I wonder if the prevalence of text and video-chat communication among young people is due to its convenience compared to writing long texts. Furthermore, I'm curious if there's a difference in communication between the young adults who were surveyed who are closer to 18 and those closer to 34. This could potentially bring to light whether certain life stages influence the amount of communication people have with parents. This is relevant to me and my community as I am going for college next year where my main form of communication with my parents will be texting and video-chatting to stay in touch  since I won't be seeing them daily.

Title:“Buzz buzz”
ace_sentences: I noticed some trends in the graph.
The smallest percentage of people visit their parents in person.
The smallest percentage is between 15% and 25%.
The largest percentage of young individuals reach out to their parents daily or a few times a week.
The largest percentage is between 50% and 75%.
There is a gender difference in communication habits.
Women are 20% more likely to use text or video-chat than men.
I wonder if the prevalence of text communication and video-chat communication among young people is due to convenience.
I wonder if text communication and video-chat communication are more convenient than writing long texts.
I am curious if there is a difference in communication between surveyed young adults who are closer to 18 and surveyed young adults who are closer to 34.
This difference could show whether certain life stages influence the amount of communication with parents.
This topic is relevant to me and my community.
I will go to college next year.
Next year, I will not see my parents daily.
In college, my main form of communication with my parents will be texting and video-chatting.
I will use texting and video-chatting to stay in touch with my parents.
